content:
When I first defined Zlattice, I decided, for some reason that I don't quite rembember, that they should be AddSubgroup, see docs#IsZlattice. It was probably because that is what is used in Minkowski Convex Body Theorem, see docs#MeasureTheory.exists_ne_zero_mem_lattice_of_measure_mul_two_pow_lt_measure. However, after having to write too many docs#AddSubgroup.toIntSubmodule and docs#AddMonoidHom.toIntLinearMap, I became convinced that Zlattice should be ℤ-modules. So I made #16604 to see what that would look like.

So my question is: do you think a Zlattice should be a AddSubgroup or a Submodule ℤ?
They're mathematically the same, as you know. So I think you should choose the version that makes your life easier, and use this as the argument for preferring one over the other.
BTW, could you please rename Zlattice toZLattice some day? I can do it myself, but I'm afraid of creating a merge conflict with your refractors.

#16622

In the same logic, I also renamed Zspan to ZSpan
